summary: This document is a sealed court order and grand jury subpoena issued to Amazon.com, Inc. on June 12, 2020, by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York. It commands Amazon to produce records related to accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Ghislaine Borgerson, and includes a non-disclosure order preventing Amazon from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days. The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations including sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena seeks all Amazon account records associated with her, including subscriber information, order history, and payment details from December 1, 2019 onward.

persons.name: Ghislaine Borgerson
persons.context: The subpoena seeks all Amazon account records associated with this name, treated similarly to Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating it may be an alias or alternate identity.

persons.name: Geoff E. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated June 12, 2020, commanding Amazon to appear and produce records.

connections.description: The subpoena seeks records for both names, indicating Borgerson is likely an alias or alternate identity used by Maxwell.

events.title: Sealed subpoena and non-disclosure order issued
events.description: The U.S. District Court issues a sealed grand jury subpoena to Amazon.com and a 2705(b) non-disclosure order preventing Amazon from notifying the account subscriber for 365 days.

events.title: Amazon compliance deadline
events.description: The date by which Amazon must produce the requested records to the grand jury or to Special Agent, unless they produce records earlier.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. government obtained a sealed grand jury subpoena for Amazon.com records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and Ghislaine Borgerson on June 12, 2020.
A non-disclosure order was issued preventing Amazon from notifying the account subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks including witness intimidation and evidence destruction.
The subpoena seeks comprehensive account records including subscriber information, IP addresses, order history from December 1, 2019, payment methods, and customer service communications.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercing travel for illegal sexual activity), and 2423(a) (transporting minors for illegal sexual activity).
The document reveals the government was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell in June 2020, shortly before her arrest in July 2020.
